snippet: Twelve restaurants will do the cooking to help honor Margaret Yardley Potter’s “At Home on the Range,” in a two-day cookbook crawl led by Elizabeth Gilbert, Ms. Potter’s great-granddaughter.
abstract: Writer Elizabeth Gilbert is planning a family reunion in Frenchtown, where she lives, to celebrate the reissue of cookbook At Home on the Range, by her great-grandmother Margaret Yardley Potter; 12 local restaurants will offer one or more dishes made from the recipes in Potter's book, which was first published in 1947 (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: Twelve restaurants will do the cooking to help honor Margaret Yardley Potter’s “At Home on the Range,” in a two-day cookbook crawl led by Elizabeth Gilbert, Ms. Potter’s great-granddaughter.

headline.seo: A Preview of the Frenchtown Cookbook Crawl
headline.main: Cooking on the Range, on the Delaware River
headline.print_headline: Cooking on the Range, on the Delaware River
